value.title: A Power Query feature you may not know about!
value.excerpt: We thought everyone knew about this Power Query capability! At the Power Platform Conference, we found that many did not. Well, we want to help make sure everyone is aware so that you can reuse your awesome Power Query work in Power BI or Excel!  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: A Power Query tip for you
value.excerpt: You probably know that you can concatenate strings in Power Query. Not big news there. But do you know how to change the order of how things are concatenated? value.title: Blown AWAY by Column From Examples in Power Query
value.excerpt: Column From Examples, in Power Query, keeps blowing our mind! Patrick shows you an example where he wanted to extract some data. Will Column From Examples work? Of course, it will! Check this out!  Add a column from examples in Power BI Desktop https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/create-reports/desktop-add-column-from-example

value.title: Copy Conditional Columns in Power Query or Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how to use conditional columns within Power Query and then copying them for use in other queries or Power BI Desktop files. This is a great technique if you don't want to retype all of the conditional items in the dialog in Power BI.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com

value.title: Getting Crazy with the Power Query UI
value.excerpt: Using Merge statements? Alex shows you how that can break the fold in Power Query! He's got you covered though and shows you a different way to approach it to make folding work! Using the UI!  Alex Powers: https://twitter.com/notaboutthecell https://www.linkedin.com/in/alexmpowers/ https://itsnotaboutthecell.com/

value.title: Inside Power Query reference queries for Power BI and Excel
value.excerpt: Chris Webb joins Patrick to look at what happens when you use reference queries for Power Query. This applies to both Power BI and Excel. value.title: Visually see where you BROKE the fold in Power Query

Adam shows you where to go.  Query plan for Power Query (Preview) https://learn.microsoft.com/power-query/query-plan  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Age Banding in Power BI using Power Query   Merge Queries Based on Between
value.excerpt: Age banding is a common scenario in analytics, and I have explained how it is possible in many different ways. One of the methods I have explained was using DAX measures and the TREATAS function. Sometimes, however, the age banding can be static, and Power Query can be used for the calculation, which

value.title: Be Careful When Merging on Text Fields in Power BI Using Power Query
value.excerpt: Merging two tables in Power Query is one of the most useful transformations to combine data from different datasets, and also create a flatten data structure. However, if you use a text field for merge, then you might see some unexpected results. Here in this video, I share some important considerations

value.title: Cartesian Product in Power Query   Multiply All Sets of All Pairs in Power BI
value.excerpt: Sometimes, you need to create a multiplication of all sets of all pairs from two different data tables in Power BI. This action is different from Merge (Join) because there is no matching key columns and no way to relate the two tables together. However, you want to create a multiplication as a flatten
